question: My child likes to draw pictures or doodles in her/his notes.
My child remembers things better when she/he sees pictures or diagrams.
It helps my child to picture something in her/his mind to remember it.
My child remembers things better when she/he hears them spoken aloud.
My child finds it helpful to listen to explanations or stories.
My child pays more attention when a teacher talks rather than uses pictures.
My child finds it easiest to remember things when she/he writes them down.
My child prefers to read instructions or notes to help him/her learn.
My child likes making lists or taking notes to remember things.
My child understands better when she/he does hands-on activities.
My child remembers things better when she/he can touch or move around.
My child gets restless if she/he has to sit still for too long.
